item.description: in a manner causing alarm or concern : in an alarming manner
item.sentence: Alarmingly, the number of people infected with the virus has been increasing rapidly.

item.description: showing or characterized by generosity, kindness, or forgiveness, especially towards a rival or someone less powerful than oneself; unselfish.
item.sentence: The billionaire's magnanimous donation to the charity greatly helped the underprivileged.

item.description: a person who is very perceptive, insightful, and has a sharp intellect to analyze situations deeply and accurately.
item.sentence: The detective's perspicacious observation skills enabled him to solve the case quickly and efficiently.

item.description: an agreement between two or more parties as to what each party will do for the other.
item.sentence: She bargained with the salesman until she got the price she wanted for the car.
The scientists carefully scrutinized the data to ensure its accuracy before publishing their findings.

item.description: plants considered collectively, especially those found in a particular area or habitat.
item.sentence: The park is known for its lush vegetation, which includes a variety of trees, bushes, and flowers.

item.description: smelling strongly of something or having qualities (especially smells) that make you think of something else
item.sentence: The aroma of freshly baked bread was redolent of my grandmother's kitchen, evoking fond memories of my childhood.

item.description: behaving or looking as though one thinks one is superior to others.
item.sentence: The businessman's supercilious attitude towards his subordinates made them feel small and insignificant.
